data.text:
Spectrasonics Omnisphere 2.8 – The Synthesizer with Endless Possibilities

Product Description

Discover the world of unlimited musical possibilities with the Spectrasonics Omnisphere 2.8, Spectrasonics’ flagship synthesizer. This award-winning software brings together different types of synthesis into one amazing sounding instrument that will inspire a lifetime of exploration. It is not for nothing that top artists around the world rely on Omnisphere as an essential source of sonic inspiration.

Advantages Omnisphere :

Hardware Synth Integration: Omnisphere is the only software synth in the world to offer a Hardware Synth Integration feature. In doing so, it transforms more than 65 well-known hardware synthesizers into comprehensive hands-on controllers that unlock Omnisphere’s newly expanded synthesis capabilities.

Improved Arpeggiator: With new Humanity and Life controls, new Presets Library, new Strumming Modifiers, Chord Voicings, Pitch Slides, Step Dividers and the ability to capture MIDI Files!

New Hardware Sound Library: Omnisphere includes a stunning new “Hardware Library” with more than 1,600 new patches created by Eric Persing and the renowned Spectrasonics Sound Development team.

Expanded Synthesis Engine: With four layers per patch, new State Variable Filters, over 500 DSP Wavetables, powerful Granular Synthesis, 8 LFOs, 12 ENVs, 34 Filter Types per part, doubled Mod Matrix and full FX Modulation.

Audio Import: You can use your own audio file as a soundsource in Omnisphere, simply by dragging it into the interface!

Good to know

The Spectrasonics Omnisphere supports a newly designed, high-resolution interface with support for HiDPI displays. The modernized GUI is now easier to use and adapt to your workspace. And best of all, the new sounds are available to ALL users, whether they use the hardware or not!

Summary

Product name: Spectrasonics Omnisphere 2.8

Category: Software Synthesizer

Features: Hardware Synth Integration, Improved Arpeggiator, New Hardware Sound Library, Expanded Synthesis Engine, Audio Import

Spectrasonics Omnisphere: A comprehensive guide for music producers

As a producer, you are always looking to expand your arsenal with new instruments. For virtual instruments, Spectrasonics Omnisphere is a name likely to come up. Omnisphere has been around for more than a decade and is a good choice for many producers.

In this comprehensive guide, we take a deep dive into why it’s so popular, how to use it to its fullest potential, and tips and tricks for getting the most out of it.

What is Spectrasonics Omnisphere?

Spectrasonics Omnisphere is a virtual instrument plugin that combines a wide variety of sounds and synthesis techniques. It is a sample-based synthesizer that allows users to create unique sounds not possible with traditional synthesizers.

It contains more than 14,000 sounds, including more than 5,000 new patches created by Spectrasonics’ sound design team. It also features a unique “Sound Match” feature that allows users to find sounds similar to the one currently in use.

The synthesis engine is based on a combination of sample-based synthesis, granular synthesis and virtual analog synthesis. It also has a powerful modulation system that allows users to modulate almost any parameter in the synth.

Why is it so popular?

One of the reasons for the popularity of this VST is its versatility. You can use it in almost any genre of music, from electronic to orchestral. The huge library of sounds and synthesis techniques allows you to create unique sounds not possible with other synthesizers.

Another reason for Spectrasonics Omnisphere’s popularity is its user interface. Despite its complexity, the interface is intuitive and easy to use. The browser makes it easy to find the sounds you want, and the modulation system is straightforward.

Using Omnisphere in your productions

When using in your productions, it is essential to understand the synthesis techniques used in the plugin. Sample-based synthesis is the basis of this instrument, and understanding how to manipulate samples is crucial to creating unique sounds.

Granular synthesis is another synthesis technique used in Omnisphere. This involves taking small parts of a sound and manipulating them to create new textures and sounds. Virtual analog synthesis is also used here and allows you to mimic classic analog sounds.

The modulation system in is incredibly powerful and allows you to modulate almost every parameter in the synth. If you know how to use the modulation system, you can take your productions to the next level.

Tips and tricks for use

Here are some tips and tricks :

Use the “Sound Match” feature to find similar sounds to the one you are currently using.

Experiment with different synthesis techniques, such as granular synthesis and virtual analog synthesis.

Use the modulation system to create evolving sounds that change over time.

Use the arpeggiator and step sequencer to create complex rhythms.

Use the effects section to add depth and dimension to your sounds.

Hardware Synth Integration

Spectrasonics Omnisphere is the only software synth in the world to offer a Hardware Synth Integration function. This remarkable innovation transforms more than 65 well-known hardware synthesizers into comprehensive hands-on controllers that unlock Omnisphere’s newly expanded synthesis capabilities.

Simply put, this groundbreaking feature makes using it feel like using a hardware synth!

Bridging the gap between physical experience between software and hardware, users gain intuitive control by using the familiar layout of their supported hardware synth.

Users of virtual instruments can now enjoy the joys of hardware synth workflow, and hardware synth users can fully expand their capabilities.

New hardware sound library

Spectrasonics Omnisphere 2.8 includes a stunning new “Hardware Library” with over 1,600 new patches created by Eric Persing and the renowned Spectrasonics Sound Development team. Each hardware profile has a corresponding set of sounds in the hardware library specifically designed using that hardware synth as the Omnisphere controller.

These inspiring new sounds span a wide range of categories and many have a distinctly ‘classic’ flavor! Remarkably, the 2.6 update takes Eric’s classic sound design work of the original 1987 Roland D-50 into a whole new sonic territory with this synthesizer’s expanded synthesis capabilities.

Best of all, the new sounds are available to ALL users regardless of whether they’re using the hardware or not!

Buy spectrasonics Omnisphere / It contains over 14,000 sounds!

Since the beginning, this synthesizer has been the sound weapon of choice for creative players and producers looking for next-level sounds on hit records, best-selling games and Oscar-winning movies. Omnisphere’s amazing sound library is constantly growing and being pushed in new directions by the award-winning Spectrasonics Sound Development Team.

You can buy Spectrasonics omnisphere at an official dealer
